metadata.Title: CVE-2020-14152 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - low.
metadata.Description:
In IJG JPEG (aka libjpeg) before 9d, jpeg_mem_available() in jmemnobs.c in djpeg does not honor the max_memory_to_use setting, possibly causing excessive memory consumption.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-14152` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libjpeg-turbo-progs - 2.0.3-0ubuntu2
libjpeg-turbo-test - 2.0.3-0ubuntu2
libjpeg-turbo8 - 2.0.3-0ubuntu2
libturbojpeg - 2.0.3-0ubuntu2
No subscription required

libjpeg-progs - 1:9d-1
libjpeg9 - 1:9d-1
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> looks like this was fixed a long time ago in libjpeg-turbo

criterions.comment: libjpeg-turbo package in kinetic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.0.3-0ubuntu2').
libjpeg6b package in kinetic is affected and needs fixing.
libjpeg9 package in kinetic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:9d-1').
